update.description:
This is an API change to make the user callbacks look like:


```
#!c++

void cb(const example::msgs::StringMsg &_msg)
```

instead of:


```
#!c++

void cb(const std::string &_topic, const example::msgs::StringMsg &_msg)
```


The motivation for this change is that most of the times the user does not need to know the topic name because callbacks are usually not shared between different topics or services. If this is the case, the user can include the topic name inside the message definition.

After merging this pull request, we'll have to update HAPTIX.

CI results:

* [Trusty is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/25/).
* [Homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/20/).
* [Windows is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/55/).
update.title: Remove topic name from user callbacks
